Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: At a cost of a percentage of their coin to cover out of pocket notarization costs.  Economically doesn‚Äôt work.   I mentioned Gresham‚Äôs law ,  ‚Äúbad money drives out the good‚Äù,   In a situation where legal tender laws ( VBK protocol for notary reimbursement ) require good and bad forms of commodity currency ( BTC = Good , Shitcoin reimbursement = bad )  to be accepted equally ( which they do in essence ).  People will spend their shitcoin and hoard their btc.  Their shitcoin markets are thinly liquid , to recoup the cost of upfronting the notarization in BTC, shitcoin has to be sold, which then devalues their currency eventually to the point that what is charged as a fee from the protected coin is not equal to the btc required for notarization.
